intro: Koellensteinia dasilvae, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It is adapted to the cool, high-altitude environments of its native habitat. Koellensteinia dasilvae is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
